intro: Staphidium mutabile, commonly known as the variable staphidium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, often in shades of pink or white. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in ecological and horticultural studies.
